anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
where does the last name orozco originate from
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Orozco is of Spanish/Basque origin. Notable people with the surname include:\n', 'Orozco was born in Fuengirola, Province of Málaga. After starting out with local UD Fuengirola Los Boliches he joined neighbouring Málaga CF in 2007, representing the reserve team in the fourth division for two seasons.\n', 'BULLET::::- Teodoro Orozco (born 1963)\n', "Rafael José Orozco Maestre (March 24, 1954 in Becerril, Cesar – June 11, 1992 in Barranquilla, Atlántico) was a Colombian singer of vallenato music. He was one of the major representatives of that Colombian popular folk music and lead singer and owner, along fellow accordionist Israel Romero, of the vallenato group Binomio de Oro de América, very popular in Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela. Orozco was assassinated by gunmen in front of his house on his daughter's 15th birthday party. It is believed they were hired by an angry drug lord whose wife-or girlfriend-was obsessed with Orozco. It has been alleged that Orozco had a sentimental relationship with 16 year old Maria Angelica Navarro Ogliasti, identified as the girlfriend of Medellin Cartel hitman Jose Reinaldo Fiallo, who was himself murdered on November 1992 on orders of Pablo Escobar.\n", 'Orozco\n']

2. It is a toponymic surname, which means it is derived from a geographical location or feature. This aligns with the understanding that surnames often have geographical roots.
3. Orozco is believed to have originated from a place name in Spain, specifically from a village or town called Orozco in the province of Biscay in the Basque Country. This detail adds specificity to the origin of the surname.
4. The surname may also be linked to the Arabic influence in Spain, as many Spanish surnames have roots in Arabic due to the historical presence of Moors in the Iberian Peninsula. This historical context provides additional depth to the understanding of the surname's etymology.
5. The name is relatively common in Spanish-speaking countries and among people of Hispanic descent, indicating its widespread use and cultural significance.

By integrating the information from the retrieved passages, the reasoning process is enhanced to include both the specific origin of the surname and its broader historical context.

**Answer:**
The last name Orozco originates from Spain, specifically from a place name in the Basque Country. It is of Spanish/Basque origin and may also reflect historical Arabic influences due to the Moors' presence in the Iberian Peninsula. The surname is relatively common in Spanish-speaking countries and among people of Hispanic descent.

Orozco was born in Fuengirola, Province of Málaga. After starting out with local UD Fuengirola Los Boliches he joined neighbouring Málaga CF in 2007, representing the reserve team in the fourth division for two seasons.
BULLET::::- Teodoro Orozco (born 1963)
Rafael José Orozco Maestre (March 24, 1954 in Becerril, Cesar – June 11, 1992 in Barranquilla, Atlántico) was a Colombian singer of vallenato music. He was one of the major representatives of that Colombian popular folk music and lead singer and owner, along fellow accordionist Israel Romero, of the vallenato group Binomio de Oro de América, very popular in Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela. Orozco was assassinated by gunmen in front of his house on his daughter's 15th birthday party. It is believed they were hired by an angry drug lord whose wife-or girlfriend-was obsessed with Orozco. It has been alleged that Orozco had a sentimental relationship with 16 year old Maria Angelica Navarro Ogliasti, identified as the girlfriend of Medellin Cartel hitman Jose Reinaldo Fiallo, who was himself murdered on November 1992 on orders of Pablo Escobar.
